conclusion: Calculate resistance of L₁: R₁ = V² / P = 3 Ω
Calculate resistance of L₂: R₂ = V² / P = 6 Ω
The moving rod acts as a d.c. generator of e.m.f. ε = B l v with an internal resistance r = 1 Ω
The two lamps are connected between the (ideal) rails, hence R₁ and R₂ are in parallel across the generator’s terminals
Voltage across the rails must be 3 V for L₁ to light normally
Calculate current through L₁: I₁ = V / R₁ = 1 A
Calculate current through L₂: I₂ = V / R₂ = 0.5 A
Calculate total load current IL = I₁ + I₂ = 1.5 A
Calculate e.m.f. of the moving rod: ε = V + IL r = 4.5 V
Speed calculation: v = ε / (B l) = 7.5 m s⁻¹, but not required for power
Calculate power delivered to L₂: P₂ = V I₂ = 1.5 W
The actual power of lamp L₂ is P₂ = 1.5 W
